lines.gurmukhi: Awid prmwid ibsmwid gurey nymh; pRgt pUrn bRhm joiq rwKI [

Unknown.translation: Salutation to the True Guru the wondrous form of the (root of all) Lord, in whom God Himself has lodged His light effulgent.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: Awid Drmwid ibsmwd gurey nmh Drmwid Drm ArQ, kwm, moK rUp cwroˆ pdwrQ jo jIvn ijMdgI dy pRXojn rUp mMny gey hn, eynwˆ dI Awid auqp`qI pRwpqI siqgurwˆ dÍwry hI huMdI hY, ies leI auh Drm Awdkwˆ dI Awid muF hn[ ienwˆ cwrwˆ Drm Awidkwˆ nUM hrwn kr dyx vwly FMg nwl ie`kvwrgI hI gur is`Kwˆ nUM pRwpq krn vwly hox kr ky auh ibsmwd rUp hn AYsy gurwˆ qweI nmskwr hovy[ pRgt pUrn bRhm joiq rwKI Awp iv`c pRq`K hI pUrn bRhm pmwqmw ny AwpxI joq itkweI hoeI hY Bwv Awp swKÎwq inrMkwr hI Enwˆ dy Awkwr ivKy swkwr ho vrq irhw hY[

lines.gurmukhi: imil cqur brn iek brn huie swDsMg; shj Duin kIrqn sbd swKI [

Unknown.translation: In the congregation assembled before God-like True Guru, praises of the Lord are sung and recited. All four varnas (caste based sections of the society) then integrate into one caste society.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: imil cqur brn iek brn huie swD sMg ienwˆ siqgurwˆ dI swD sMg siqsMgq ivKy cwroˆ brn bRwhmx KÎqRI sUdr vYSÎ iek brn is`K bx jwˆdy hn, Aqy shj Duin kIrqn sbd swKI ies siqsMg ivKy Sbd gurbwxI dy Sbdwˆ qQw swKI Sbd pRmwxwˆ dw kIrqn sihj DunI nwl b`JvIˆ qih nwl hoXw krdw hY[

lines.gurmukhi: nwm inhkwm inj Dwm gurisK sRvn; Duin gurisK sumiq AlK lwKI [

Unknown.translation: A Sikh of the Guru whose base is Lord's name, listens to the melodious paeans of the Lord's praise. He then realises his self that helps him perceive the imperceptible.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: nwm inhkwm inj Dwm gurisK SRvn Duin gurisK sumiq AlK lwKI nwm hY inSkwm inrivklp APurpd ijs AvsQw dw auh hY inj Dwm gurwˆ dw, auQy surq itkw ky is`K suxdy hn Duin Anhd nwd ijs dy pRBwv kr ky pRwpq ho AOˆdI hY guris`Kwˆ nUM sumiq Awqm ivKYxI buDI AlK dI lKqw krOx hwrI[

lines.gurmukhi: ikMcq ktwC kir ikRpw dY jwih lY; qwih Avgwih ipRAY pRIiq cwKI [144[

Unknown.translation: The True Guru showers his benediction in very small measure on such a person who gets engrossed in it and relishes the loving elixir of Lord's love. (144)
